nodes.text:
(alias) function createWalletClient<transport extends Transport, chain extends Chain | undefined = undefined, accountOrAddress extends Account | Address | undefined = undefined, rpcSchema extends RpcSchema | undefined = undefined>(parameters: WalletClientConfig<transport, chain, accountOrAddress, rpcSchema>): WalletClient<transport, chain, ParseAccount<accountOrAddress>, rpcSchema>
import createWalletClient
nodes.docs:
Creates a Wallet Client with a given [Transport](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/intro) configured for a [Chain](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/chains).

- Docs: https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet

A Wallet Client is an interface to interact with [Ethereum Account(s)](https://ethereum.org/en/glossary/#account) and provides the ability to retrieve accounts, execute transactions, sign messages, etc. through [Wallet Actions](https://viem.sh/docs/actions/wallet/introduction).

The Wallet Client supports signing over:
- [JSON-RPC Accounts](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet#json-rpc-accounts) (e.g. Browser Extension Wallets, WalletConnect, etc).
- [Local Accounts](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet#local-accounts-private-key-mnemonic-etc) (e.g. private key/mnemonic wallets).

nodes.text:
(alias) function http<rpcSchema extends RpcSchema | undefined = undefined, raw extends boolean = false>(url?: string | undefined, config?: HttpTransportConfig<rpcSchema, raw>): HttpTransport<rpcSchema, raw>
import http
tags: Creates a HTTP transport that connects to a JSON-RPC API.

nodes.text: import Account
import WebAuthnP256
const credential: WebAuthnP256.P256Credential
import WebAuthnP256

function createCredential(parameters: WebAuthnP256.createCredential.Parameters): Promise<WebAuthnP256.createCredential.ReturnValue>
namespace createCredential
nodes.docs:
Creates a WebAuthn credential (ie. a passkey).

This function returns the credential object, which includes the public key.
It is recommended to store the public key against the credential in an external store
as it is not possible to extract a public key from a credential after it has been created.

nodes.text: (property) label: string
const account: Account.RootAccount
import Account

function fromWebAuthnP256(credential: Account.fromWebAuthnP256.Credential, options?: Account.fromWebAuthnP256.Options): Account.fromWebAuthnP256.ReturnValue
namespace fromWebAuthnP256
nodes.docs: Instantiates an Account from a WebAuthn credential.

Creates a Wallet Client with a given [Transport](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/intro) configured for a [Chain](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/chains).

- Docs: https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet

A Wallet Client is an interface to interact with [Ethereum Account(s)](https://ethereum.org/en/glossary/#account) and provides the ability to retrieve accounts, execute transactions, sign messages, etc. through [Wallet Actions](https://viem.sh/docs/actions/wallet/introduction).

The Wallet Client supports signing over:
- [JSON-RPC Accounts](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet#json-rpc-accounts) (e.g. Browser Extension Wallets, WalletConnect, etc).
- [Local Accounts](https://viem.sh/docs/clients/wallet#local-accounts-private-key-mnemonic-etc) (e.g. private key/mnemonic wallets).

nodes.text: (property) transport: HttpTransport<undefined, false>

(alias) http<undefined, false>(url?: string | undefined, config?: HttpTransportConfig<undefined, false> | undefined): HttpTransport<undefined, false>
import http
tags: Creates a HTTP transport that connects to a JSON-RPC API.

nodes.docs:
Creates, signs, and sends a new transaction to the network synchronously.
Returns the transaction receipt.

- Docs: https://viem.sh/docs/actions/wallet/sendTransactionSync
- Examples: https://stackblitz.com/github/wevm/viem/tree/main/examples/transactions_sending-transactions
- JSON-RPC Methods:
  - JSON-RPC Accounts: [`eth_sendTransaction`](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_sendtransaction)
  - Local Accounts: [`eth_sendRawTransaction`](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_sendrawtransaction)

nodes.text: (property) data: "0xcafebabe"
(property) to: "0xdeadbeefdeadbeefdeadbeefdeadbeefdeadbeef"
